name: Globally Trivial Cities 'G' Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following cities is in the Caribbean?
questions.explanation:
Grenville.

	Grenville is a city on the east coast of Grenada and is the island's second largest city; Glasgow is in Scotland; Guatemala City is in Guatemala, the Mayan heartland of Central America; and, Gabu is in Guinea-Bissau, once the Kingdom of Gabu, and now one of the world's best cashew producing nations (I love cashews)!

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in the Southern Hemisphere?
questions.explanation:
Gisborne.

	Gisborne is a city on the east coast of New Zealand and is the first city in the world to see the sun each day!  Genoa, in the centre of the Italian Riviera, is an industrial port city; Ghardaia is a city in the Algerian Sahara Desert; and, Ghent (or Gent) is the fourth largest city in Belgium and lies on the banks of three rivers, the Lys, Lieve and Scheldt.

questions.text: Which of the following is a small city in Greece?
questions.explanation:
Galatas.

	Galatas 'the pearl in the Saronic Gulf' is a city in Greece; Graz, founded in 1128, is the capital of the state of Styria in south eastern Austria; Galway is a city in Ireland known as the 'Venice of the West'; and, Genoa is an Italian city.

questions.text: Which of the following is an African city?
questions.explanation:
Garoua.

	Garoua is a city in the north of Cameroon, between the borders with Nigeria and Chad; Galveston is a Texan city in the USA, a charming 'island city' on the Gulf of Mexico; Goa is a city in India which was liberated in 1961 from 451 years of Portuguese Colonial Rule; and, Groningen is a 'car-free' city in the north of The Netherlands.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in Europe?
questions.explanation:
Georgetown.

	Georgetown is the picturesque capital city of Guyana; Groningen is a city in the north of the Netherlands that was heavily bombed during WWII; Graz is a city in Austria; and cosmopolitan Geneva is a city in Switzerland located on the south western shores of Lake Geneva.

questions.text: Which of the following is an Asian city?
questions.explanation:
Guangzhou.

	Guangzhou (also known as Canton) is a city in China, only a few hours from Hong Kong; Golfito is in Costa Rica, Central America, north of the border with Panama and its name means, little gulf; Gonder is a city in Ethiopia, Eastern Africa, and was once the capital; and, Geraldton is a coastal city, with the nickname 'Sun City', in the midwest of Western Australia and also a small town in northwestern Ontario, Canada.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in Oceania?
questions.explanation:
Grafton.

	Grafton is a city with wide, tree-lined streets on the Clarence River in northern New South Wales, Australia; Gatineau is a city in Quebec, Canada near the scenic Lemay Lake; Genoa is an Italian city; and, Gdansk, a port city on the Gulf of Danzig was established in the 10th century, in Poland.

questions.text: Which of the following cities is in France?
questions.explanation:
Grenoble.

	Grenoble is a city in France, situated on the Drac and Isère rivers and surrounded by mountains; Gaflei is a city in Liechtenstein, located east of the capital city; Gaborone is the capital city of Botswana, from where you can take a short trip to visit the house of David Livingstone; and, GonaIves is a city in western Haiti, on the Gulf of GonaIves where, in 1804, Haiti's independence was proclaimed.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in the Americas?
questions.explanation:
Guanajuato.

	Guanajuato is a city in Mexico, founded in 1548, UNESCO has classified Guanajuato as a World Heritage Site; The city of Gostivar is located in the west of the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, in the upper part of the Polog Valley; Guanghua is in China. Goroka is a city in Papua New Guinea, 400km north west of Port Moresby.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in the Americas?
questions.explanation:
Groesbeek.

	Groesbeek is a city in The Netherlands near the German border; Granada is a city in Nicaragua, Central America, founded in 1524 on the shores of Lake Nicaragua; Golfito is in Costa Rico, Central America, north of the border with Panama; Guatemala City is the capital city of Guatemala in Central America.  In 1773 an earthquake destroyed the former capital and the  new capital was named Nueva Guatemala de la Asunción by royal decree and was officially inaugurated in 1776.
